        };

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl24_divTabs_0","title":"Public Health Alert","content":"
Important Information 
\nabout COVID-19\n
Click here to view Harrison Public Schools' 
\nEmergency Health Closure Plan: District Overview
\n
\nClick here for Distance Learning Plans in English and Spanish
\n
\nClick here for Student/Staff Support Services contact information.
\n\n
\n
\nA Message from Dr. James P. Doran, 
\nDirector of Personnel/Human Resources/Compliance 
\nand Crisis Management for Harrison Public Schools
\nPara la versión en español haga clic aquí 
\nApril 20, 2020 
\n\n
An important message to parents, staff, and students of the Harrison Public Schools:\n
As you know Governor Murphy’s Executive Order for Distance Learning will remain in effect until May 15th for all NJ Schools.  In compliance, all Harrison Public Schools will resume Distance Learning mode on Monday, April 20th. Students will complete their lessons from home via teacher prepared learning packets, laptops, smartphones, or other internet-ready devices. \n
We are seeking the help of parents and guardians to assist children in completing lessons.  Please keep in mind that the NJ Department of Education will only count these distance learning days as mandated school days when student attendance is taken by the teachers and evidence of student work is completed.  \n
Throughout this Distance Learning period, FREE ‘grab-n-go’ breakfast and lunch will be served for ALL CHILDREN  at Washington Middle School from 9:00AM to 1:00PM.\n
During this Distance Learning process, parents should contact the appropriate principal's office as needed regarding technology, health, and other support services.  Child study team members and other related services staff will be contacting parents and students directly to arrange for additional services.\n
Again, all Harrison Public Schools will remain in Distance Learning mode from home for all students through May 15th.\n
On behalf of the Harrison Board of Education and Administration, we pray for, and offer our support for those who have been stricken with the CoronaVirus. We also encourage all to continue to practice shelter-in-place, social distancing and effective measures to avoid contracting the virus.\n
For further information please visit harrisonschools.org.\n
Thank You.\n
Previous Updates:
\nApril 5, 2020
\n\n
An important message to parents, staff, and students of the Harrison Public Schools:\n
\n
\nOn behalf of the Harrison Board of Education, the Administration, and the Principals we want to thank all the students, parents and teachers for their amazing performance during this distance learning program.  
\n
\nAs we enter our third week of distance learning, we want to remind all students and parents to reach out to your school’s principal if you are having any trouble with technology or need any other type of support or counseling service.  We will be posting a complete list of contact phone numbers and emails on the school’s web site for you to reach out.
\n
\nPlease remember that Distance Learning will be in session all this week Monday through Friday with a single session on Friday.  School will be closed for Spring Recess from Monday, April 13 through Friday April 17th and resume on Monday April 20th.
\n
\nThroughout this distance learning period, and during the Spring Break, free ‘grab-n-go’ breakfast and lunch will be served to all students at Washington Middle School from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM.\n
\n
\nAgain, we thank all the teachers, students and parents for their untiring efforts during these very challenging times. For more information, please visit www.harrisonschools.org.\n\n
                               \t                         Previous Updates:
\nMarch 30, 2020
\nPara la versión en español haga clic aquí
\n\n
An important message to parents, staff, and students of the Harrison Public Schools:\n
In accordance with Governor Murphy’s Executive Order all Harrison schools will continue the Distance Learning Program until further notice. Students will continue to complete their lessons from home via teacher prepared learning packets, laptops, smartphones, or other internet-ready devices.\n
Again, we are seeking the help of parents and guardians to assist children in completing lessons. Our Distance Learning plan and letter to parents is available on the district website at harrisonschools.org.  Again, please be reminded that the NJ Department of Education will only count these distance learning days as mandated school days when student attendance is taken by the teachers and evidence of student work is completed. \n
Throughout this Distance Learning period, free ‘grab-n-go’ breakfast and lunch will be served for ALL CHILDREN 18 and under.  Please note the change of times that breakfast and lunch will be served at Washington Middle School from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM.\n
During this Distance Learning process, parents should contact the appropriate principal's office as needed regarding technology, health, and other support services.  Child Study Team members and other related services staff will be contacting parents and students directly to arrange for additional services.\n
Again, all Harrison Public Schools will continue the Distance Learning from home for all students and continue throughout Governor Murphy’s Executive Order. For information on the COVID19 crisis, please refer to the district’s website at harrisonschools.org. Thank you.
\n
\n\n
Students and parents have been emailed an important flyer from the New Jersey Department of Health and CDC 
\nregarding COVID-19 (also known as \"coronavirus\".) 
\nClick the image below to view the flyer. 
\nSpanish and Simplified Chinese flyers available underneath the flyer.
\n \n
\nInformation in English
\nInformation in Spanish
\nInformation in Simplified Chinese
\n
\n\n

\n
\nSTEPS ON HOW TO GAIN ACCESS TO WIFI\n
1. Visit xfinity.com/wifi to see a map of Xfinity WiFi hotspots. Open hotspots, both indoor and outdoor, will be displayed on the map in a blue color. Once at a hotspot, customers and non-customers should select xfinitywifi from the list of available WiFi networks, and then launch a browser. (please note that it must be 'xfinitywifi' all small letters, any other xfinity wifi will take you to one that requires a login)
\n\n
2. Non-Xfinity Internet customers can connect by clicking the Accept & Connect button.\nNon-Xfinity customers will be able to renew their complimentary\nsessions every two hours. (so you'll have to renew your connection and\nstart these steps over every 2 hours)\n
\n
\nNJTV LEARNING PROGRAMMING
\n\n
Starting on April 6, 2020, children in grades 3-6 will be able to tune in each weekday to lessons taught by New Jersey educators. Click here for archived lessons and click here to find where to watch NJTV.
\n
\nNJTV Education Flyer- English
\nNJTV Education Flyer- Spanish\n
\n
\n
\n\n\n
 ","active":true,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl24_divTabs_1","title":"Welcome","content":"The Harrison School District serves a multi-cultural pre-K to 12th grade student population through partnerships with teachers, parents and the community by providing comprehensive educational programs which encourage all students to:
\n
\n•Develop to their fullest potential 
\n•Welcome the challenge of higher order thinking as a means of understanding complex issues 
\n•Become well adjusted, productive and contributing citizens ready to confront the challenges of an advancing technological society 
\n•Take pride in community, country and show concern for the environment 
\n•Develop self-esteem and respect for others 
\n
\nThe Harrison School District will be guided by its district objectives and evaluation process in the delivery of its educational programs.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl24_divTabs_2","title":"Superintendent's Office","content":"\n    \n

a.title: Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying (Harrison's BOE Policy)

br.a: Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying (Harrison's BOE Policy)

hr.p: Harrison Education Foundation has been accepted as one of Amazon.Com Smile eligible charities. Every time you use Amazon.com please use the following unique charity link: https://smile.amazon.com/ch/27-4319917

div.p: McKinney Vento Education Program | McKinney Vento Act Know The Facts

"It is the policy of the Board of Education of the Harrison Public Schools not to discriminate in its programs, activities, employment practices or admission policies on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, ancestry, national origin, genetics, affectional and sexual orientation, disability or social or economic status."
Inquiries or complaints regarding affirmative action, discrimination (including Title IX requirements), sexual harassment or equity should be directed to:
Joan McNichol, AAO/Section 504 Officer/Title IX Coordinator
joan.mcnichol@staff.harrisonschools.org
div.hr: This is meant to notify staff, parents, and the community that the Harrison Board of Education is in compliance with AHERA (Asbestos Hazard Emergency Response Act) regulations. Six Month Periodic Asbestos Surveillances and Three Year Plans are available in the Board of Education office located at 517 Hamilton Street, Harrison, N.J. for your review during normal business hours.
